title: 15+ Mildly infuriating ways people got tricked on April Fool's Day
description: April Fool's Day jokes are an enduring annual tradition. Whether it's your dad playing a clever dad joke or your boss delivering a "box of donuts" to the office, you just might get pranked on April 1 each year! Pranks for this hallowed day can be as effortless as telling a loved one that you're pregnant when you're definitely not, which is a classic. If you've got kids, you can find plenty of ways to prank them, just like one parent who froze their kids' cereal. When the kids go to take a bite, they try to lift their spoon, only to realize they've been duped. It's the little things like this that make parenting so rewarding. Check out a bunch of cute, funny, and irritating April Fool's pranks below. Next, read about the reason that this person's roommates created a whole separate group chat to complain about their "cheap" dinner habits: "We were basically told that we're not good hosts."
author: Remy Millisky
excerpt: 15+ Mildly infuriating ways people got tricked on April Fool's Day - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.

html:
April Fool's Day jokes are an enduring annual tradition. Whether it's your dad playing a clever dad joke or your boss delivering a "box of donuts" to the office, you just might get pranked on April 1 each year! 

Pranks for this hallowed day can be as effortless as telling a loved one that you're pregnant when you're definitely not, which is a classic. If you've got kids, you can find plenty of ways to prank them, just like one parent who froze their kids' cereal. When the kids go to take a bite, they try to lift their spoon, only to realize they've been duped. It's the little things like this that make parenting so rewarding. Check out a bunch of cute, funny, and irritating April Fool's pranks below. 

Next, read about the reason that this person's roommates created a whole separate group chat to complain about their "cheap" dinner habits: "We were basically told that we're not good hosts."
